entry.title: Clark Kent vs The Batman
entry.summary:
Author: noodlerdoodler

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 998Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 0

Summary: When Clark arrived at the office, running late again, Lois didn’t wait to slide her chair over to his desk. From the sparkle in her eye, he knew something was up.“So, I have an assignment for you, rookie.” Lois said, as a way of greeting.She had already been working at The Daily Planet when Clark was hired, so they had a running joke about her being his superior. Occasionally, it came up in the bedroom. Though, it was more commonly used as a way of teasing him at work, especially when they had been keeping their relationship under wraps.“You know I have to talk to the mayor about the pipe.” Clark responded, already scribbling in the notepad he kept on his desk.“This is a little more exciting than broken pipes.”

entry.title: It's only polite
entry.summary:
Author: hkandi

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,787Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 6

Summary: When Superman is invited to go to the Batcave, he brings a gift for Batman, because it's the polite thing to do. And if he continues to do that, since it's awful nice of the Dark Knight to keep inviting him, well, it becomes fun for Clark to shop for the other man. And leads to more questions than answers for Bruce, until he gets some surprising information...

entry.title: World's Finest
entry.summary:
Author: Salamence_373

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,376Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 38

Summary: Clark is new to Metropolis after landing his dream job as a journalist at the Daily Planet that's in a frenzy covering the new hero Superman that's moved to town. Bruce has been fighting as Batman for three years but still has a long way to go juggling his double life. These two have been searching for meaning as they strive towards their ultimate goals on an inevitable collision course. Their rivalry sparks new passion from both of them as they find out they aren't so different after all, while finding what's been missing from their lives. They each bring out the best in each other and make them better heroes and people as they build for a better tomorrow.

entry.title: princess of gotham (you're queen in my heart)
entry.summary:
Author: April_Blooms

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,751Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 28

Summary: Superbat Week Day 3- Prompt: Genderswap When a speedforce anomaly transports them to a different dimension, Bruce, Clark, and Wally discover themselves in a world exactly like their own except for one small detail. oOo “We're in Gotham!” Wally exclaims “Not our Gotham.” Bruce grits. “That shop closed down three months ago. This entire block is four feet longer than it should be. And in our world-” A street sign shimmers in the rain. Bruce grimaces. “In our world- there is no Lady Wayne Avenue.” “Lady Wayne.” Clark says. "Why that name?" “One of two options. One, my mother did more charity work in this world independently of my father, enough to secure a separate name for herself and a knighthood. Or, the more likely option, a simple change of chromosome or brain chemistry in her only child.” There is a third option. But of course, Bruce doesn't even consider that.

entry.title: Boy, You're an Alien.
entry.summary:
Author: fzanchikk

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,960Chapters: 8/8Kudos: 207

Summary: ______________________________________ "So you're telling me," Bruce says, voice dangerously low, "That I'm the first person who's ever had you like this?" He steps forward, forcing Clark back against the ledge again. One hand cups his jaw, thumb brushing over those kiss-swollen lips. "Not some random hook-up. Not a fling." His breath hitches—just slightly. "Me." A beat. "...You really are a fucking alien."______________________________________ Bruce Wayne gets the opportunity to teach a fellow Kryptonian on how to properly love, but is it really teaching when he's also experiencing genuine love for the first time? ______________________________________
